comment: I highly recommend NOT taking Jennifer Mitchell's Music in Society class. I took this class online for a general education credit, and she ghosted both our entire class and her superiors for about three and a half weeks. She takes incredibly long to respond to emails, she reuses her lectures from years prior, and I haven't learned a thing.

Weekly discussions on long videos and connect assignment over textbook chapter. Use check my work and get 100. Read rubric for everything her instructions are unclear. 2 concert attendance. Final is a group project in an online class which is recipe for disaster. Over all probably would not recommend. Some good some bad but not the worst.

Great communication skills, outgoing personality, and well put together/interesting lectures. The weekly homework on connect is super easy, but takes some time to do. She is a really fun professor. Lots of extra credit. Lots of funny discussions with the class. For the group project search the topic before you pick and befriend your group!

Go to class every week, and read ahead for when quizzes are. Take lots of notes if there's a quiz that week. She's very fun, down-to-earth, and approachable. There's some textbook busywork every week that's tedious but easy, and there were no tests, only a final group project. Do well on that and the quizzes, and you've got an A in the bag.

Horrible class! Lecture is so boring and most of the time you watch videos just to talk about them. Waste of time. Then the quizzes are horrible. They make no sense and no information on the topics are anywhere. Pointless class but was required for my major which is why I had to take it. Wouldnt recommend!

She likes to have a good time in her classes, which I enjoyed. There's a module due every week before class and usually an extra assignment, neither of which are bad. Teaching is engaging and attendance is only mandatory sometimes, and she'll tell you when. The only thing I didn't like was the music she liked, just not exactly the traditional.d

I took this class asynchronously and it was really fun! I think it would be fun for any music buff! The professor is really interesting and cool! There is weekly homework (easy) a lot of concert papers. None of it is hard, but you do have to put in the work. The final is a project (can work in groups).
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--So many papers

comment: Took her intro music course during FALL 20. Being an online only course there is heaps of homework and concert reports. She does offer a healthy amount of extra credit options that will help. It definitely is a tough course, however I am not a music major. Be ready to write a ton of papers that will be graded pretty strictly.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: She is a good caring professor, but if you dont show up to class, you will fail. she takes attendance which i hated, but honestly sit in the back and she wont see you on your phone or on your laptop screwing around. quizzes were hard, but not that bad. 2 essays, a group project and presentation. she tries to be funny, but its more nerdy and goofy
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Very great professor
She is a great professor but the quizzes are very hard

Okay, so her class herself isnt that bad. I actually really enjoyed her teaching style and lectures. However, she treats everyone like they are music majors and makes the class way more difficult than a gen ed intro to music class should be. Her quizzes are CHALLENGING to say the least. I had to work harder to pass this intro class than Any class.
She made this way to difficult. Avoid her
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Her quizzes are kind of hard, but go to class and take notes on the lectures and it's easy.

very nice and funny. however she made us spend a lot of money going to two ksu concerts and one expensive atlanta symphony a concert and write a report on it. btw not really explaining what should be in it. but it was an alright class. made some friends

Professor Mitchell led an okay class. Her teaching style is definitely lecture heavy. The topics are insanely easy at the start, but become a lot more obscure and very specific as it goes on. There will often be questions on the test that are not directly taught. There is a group presentation at the end. The homework is extremely tedious. 6.5/10

It wont matter whether or not you take notes bc this teacher assigns a quiz(basically a test) for all 13 chapters and makes them very specific questions based on small details from her lectures. Theyre open note on lockdown browser but the PPTS barely help and the wording of the questions make it where you cant really google it either. Bad Teacher.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: One of the worst mistakes Ive ever made was taking this teacher. Shes a nice lady but will make you want to pull out your hair with her impossible, bs quizzes and concert reports. I took detailed notes on the important things that she says (basically everything) and I still barely manage to crank out 80's and 70's on them. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!!!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: DO NOT TAKE THIS TEACHER! She will talk about herself the entire time during the class and then quiz you on very unimportant material. Her quizzes are on Lockdown Browser. Even though they are open notes, the material is nearly impossible to look up.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Jenn was passionate about music and transferred that energy to her students during lectures. She inspired students to have appreciation for the art and history of music. I would recommend this professor to all students.

Worst professor I have ever had. I honestly dont know why I didnt drop this class earlier... If you take notes in class it wont matter because her tests arent even over what she goes over in class smh
Funny and quirky
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY--Caring

comment: Nice lady, However, her quizzes are entirely too hard and she is completely aware of the fact that they are. She mentioned being told that before. They rely heavily on her lectures. So if you miss anything you're screwed. She does give extra credit and it helps. Also, I hated the fact we had to spend extra money to attend concerts for our reports.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I personally never paid attention to her lectures and never did extra credit, but the quizzes are really hard and you have to do a lot of work outside of just studying for the quizzes. I would NOT at all recommend this class to anyone who hasn't been part of a musical ensemble before. If you do the essays well and extra credit class is an easy A.

Extremely, extremely lecture heavy. DO NOT WRITE YOUR NOTES--TYPE THEM INSTEAD. If you miss 5 seconds of lectures, then you'll probably miss a question or two on the quizzes. She gives a lot of extra credit. You will spend extra $ to go to mandatory concerts, and write reports about them. I will not, ever, in my life, take this class, again...
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Be prepared to spend hours writing 3-4 page weekly essays and composing with no real teaching or substantial lectures provided. At one point she said, "Oh, I won't teach how to transpose, its just too hard to explain, read it in the book instead." This class was a waste of time and resources, I left that class regretting signing up for it.

Her lectures are fantastic and always so interesting and fun. She has the best sense of humor and she is approachable. Her quizzes can be difficult because they rely heavily on the lectures, so don't skip or get the notes from a classmate. She also gives a ridiculous amount of extra credit. Just go to class and take notes and you should be okay.

Not exactly an easy slide by for a music class, but it's not hard to pull off. Tough quizzes, long lectures, material isn't interesting, as well as multiple concert reports. BUT, obscene amount of extra credit, she's extremely accessible and she's kinda funny. She's an easy grader on all reports/project. Class is fine if you take the time.

She made this very hard for a gen ed class, test were almost impossible to get a B. There were also a lot of papers to write which was ridiculous! However, if you don't miss any classes, you get extra credit. You have to go to concerts and write a 3-4 page paper, one being an Atlanta Symphony Concert, which is in Atlanta. but I pulled out an A.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--SO MANY PAPERS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: She is great but so many work for gen ed class (like we are music majors). Her exams are extremely hard so you need to attend classes and take good notes since it's lectured base. You have 3 concert reports including Atlanta Symphony Orchestra. Most extra credits are off campus which you have to pay most of them.

Incredibly outgoing and funny! The only difficult part were her tests so be sure to attend class & take notes during lectures. Regarding essays for concerts: be sure to understand the criteria and use key terms. if you feel like you won't pass, just complete any of the tons of extra credit opportunities she gives you. I ushered and made an easy A!

Jen is super funny and absolutely LOVES CATS. Her tests are extremely hard, even though they're open notes. They're manageable though. Don't go into this class thinking it's easy. You have to work for your grade. She offers so much extra credit though that you could fail all the tests and still have an A in the class.

If I knew this class was this bad I would have taken art. She orally gives notes so if you miss something while taking notes you're out of luck. Her tests are super hard and even admits it. She will give u extra credit but it takes you actually leaving campus to see a concert which u write a report on. She expects way too much for non-music majors.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I am a straight A student and this is honestly the hardest class i have taken. She talks fast and if you miss one thing she says you're screwed. The test are absolutely impossible if you are a non music major. Also be prepared to write many long papers. Even if you enjoy music, do not take this class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: kinda strange, but overall a pretty good teacher. her tests are VERY hard though. she has a powerpoint for every unit so make sure you're present or you won't get the notes you need for the tests. this class isn't as easy as i thought it would be. be prepared to write concert reports.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: She is funny, she is obsessed with cats. Her tests are hard, and i studied for a long time. she gives you 30 points of extra credit by going to concerts and ushering concerts on campus. so if you have a 70% in the class, and you usher five concerts(10 points). and attend five extra credit concerts. you can now have a 100% in the class.

Very funny and quirky. Extremely long tests but she prepares you well for them. Offers TONS of extra credit. She is willing to work with students and understands that students have other priorities. Lectures are very long, as she is very passionate about the subject. Would take again.

She's awesome, and really into music. Ask and talk about music with her and she'll yap her head off about it, which I freakin love. Her tests are structured alike. The first test might catch you off guard, but the rest will usually be easier. She gives so much extra credit that making an A in this class is almost guaranteed if you put in the work.

Ms. Mitchell is great! I took her for music 1107 and at the beginning of the year she said, "this is a required course, so I'm making it as easy as possible." She's stayed true to her word - her tests are the same as the powerpoints and she gives a ton of extra credit that adds on to your tests and to your final grade in the class.

The subject isn't that interesting, but she makes it entertaining. She's really quirky and passionate about music. Make sure to do the concert reports and study for the quizzestests. Don't bother buying the book, she teaches everything in lectures.
I wouldn't recommend. Strict grader, but not good enough as a teacher to justify it. Super nice and chill though. If you're just trying to satisfy your requirements, look somewhere else.

Jen is very understanding of her students. Although she is unorganized, her classes are fun and keeps you on your toes. There is a workload, but nothing that takes up too much time. She'd love it if you get to know her, because she says "once my student, always my student".
Loved Jen! She's really passionate about what she teaches, but her tests are difficult. Focus on listening examples for tests. Gives ton of extra credit. Attendance counts.

offers 2 hard test, but she gives much extra credit. 3 concerts with 2 page papers but she loves the give out 100's on them.  She said you need the disk in the book for listening examples but you can just pull them up off of youtube.  never used the book, failed both test, and still made an A

She is funny & tries to keep class interesting. The history can be very boring, so she plays lots of music. Offers lots of extra credit. Tests are easy, but need to know music examples.Event attendance is a hassle but I think its KSU mandated (not her policy). Dont bother with the textbook just take notes (word for word on exam). Overall fun class!

She is a nice teacher but teaches the gen-ed music class as if it is for music majors.  Otherwise she is ok, I would not recommend taking this class if you are just trying to satisfy the university requirements!  Take theater!

Professor Mitchell is one of my favorite professors. Although music history may not be interesting to everybody, she made class fun every day. She's very quirky and funny, but more importantly she knows what she's talking about. Tests are not hard, but you must study/know the musical examples she provides. I HIGHLY recommend her.

She's a really quirky lady, but the material covered it pretty boring.  There is one quiz, two tests, and a group project.  Plus, you have to attend two KSU concerts and one ASO concert and write papers about all three.  I know there are easier music professors at Kennesaw, but I was overall impressed by this class.
